snippet: President Obama emerged from the second debate with Mitt Romney having settled nerves within his party and claimed a new chance to frame the presidential race with just three weeks until Election Day.
abstract: News Analysis; Pres Obama's aggressive performance at the second presidential debate has settled anxiety among Democrats; whether it will decisively reroute the course of the campaign remains to be seen, but he has given his party a new chance to frame the terms of the race just three weeks before Election Day.
lead_paragraph: President Obama emerged from the second debate with Mitt Romney having settled nerves within his party and claimed a new chance to frame the presidential race with just three weeks until Election Day.

headline.seo: In Second Debate, Obama Strikes Back
headline.main: For the President, Punch, Punch, Another Punch
